description: ​Ethical Evolution: Thriving at the Crossroads of Law and Business in the AI Era

Things can often become murky at the intersection of law and business ethics, especially in our evolving technological landscape. In this presentation, we’re offering insights to help you stay ahead of the curve while navigating business and legal ethics. Please note this program is accredited for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE in California, North Carolina, South Carolina (all levels), and Texas.
​Content Creator Law by a Content Creator

Content creation is arguably a relatively new profession based in our current social media landscape. The brand deals entered into by creators often present unique considerations and legal concerns. Join Justia Webinars to learn more about content creator law - directly from a content creator/attorney! Please note this program is accredited for one hour of General MCLE credit in California, North Carolina, South Carolina (all levels), and Texas.
​Attorney Licensure and the Impaired Professional

Substance use disorders and mental health challenges can affect any attorney regardless of gender, culture, ethnicity, age, or socioeconomic status. This presentation instructs attorneys on how to recognize the impaired professional, provides various resources to assist in the recovery, and identifies the possible disciplinary implications of impaired attorneys' conduct. Please note this program is accredited for one hour of Competence Issues MCLE credit in California, one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health MCLE credit in North Carolina and South Carolina (all levels), and one hour of MCLE credit in Texas, of which one hour will apply to Legal Ethics MCLE credit.
​Podcasting 101: Advising Clients in Preproduction, Production, and Distribution

Whether your clients are creating true crime, comedy, or talk show podcasts, a number of agreements are required to turn an idea into a production. Attendees at this Justia Webinar can expect to learn more about the law surrounding podcast production in this one-hour program! Please note this program is accredited for one hour of General MCLE credit in California, North Carolina, South Carolina (all levels), and Texas.
​Driving Your Success: Essential Habits for Law Firm Associates in the Post-Pandemic Landscape

In today's rapidly evolving legal landscape and workplace, associates must develop certain habits and skills that lead not only to improved legal acumen but also to meaningful relationships, a differentiated reputation, and individually aligned professional opportunities. Stream this on-demand webinar to learn more about the ways law firm associates can position themselves for success in the legal profession.
​Build Your All-Star Team With Inclusive Interviewing

Even law firms that make a conscious effort to promote diversity often find that implicit biases impact recruiting and retention efforts. Watch this on-demand course to learn more about implicit bias in law firm hiring and retention and how you can combat this in your practice. This program is eligible for one hour of Implicit Bias MCLE credit in California, one hour of General MCLE credit in South Carolina, and one hour of MCLE credit in Texas, of which one hour applied to the Legal Ethics requirement.
​Navigating & Mitigating Ethical Conflicts in Estate Administration & Planning

Estate Planning attorneys often face a unique web of ethical challenges in their practices. Stream this webinar to explore the different types of intrafamilial conflicts faced by estate attorneys and strategies to mitigate them. Please note, this course is eligible for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE credit in California.
